question.question-text: How do the students organize their discussion?

answer-list.answer-text: By discussing one author after another
By taking turns presenting different short stories
By meeting on different days to discuss different types of literature

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the students say I've got my syllabus right here, let's look over what's going on this week,…let's review Monday's class first,…let's move on to Wednesday's class, and for tomorrow, we're supposed to read Poe's famous poem, "The Raven." From this, it can be determined that the students organize their discussion by following the class syllabus. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: How many times have these students most likely met to discuss this course?

question.question-text: Based on the information in the conversation, indicate whether the statements below reflect Poe's philosophy of good writing.

answer-text.exp: All elements of a novel must be unified.
Every detail in a short story needs to be unified.
Short stories should always be cheerful.

explain-list.explain-text: In the discussion, one of the students says Poe's most famous piece of literary criticism was his review of a book of short stories by Nathaniel Hawthorne. From this, it can be determined that it is NOT part of Poe's philosophy that one author cannot criticize another. You should therefore click in the NO column.

In the discussion, one of the students says a successful novel can have a variety of different elements. From this, it can be determined that it is NOT part of Poe's philosophy that all elements of a novel must be unified. You should therefore click in the NO column.

In the discussion, one of the students says a successful short story needs to be unified, to have everything lead to one unified whole. From this, it can be determined that it is part of Poe's philosophy that every detail in a short story needs to be unified. You should therefore click in the YES column.

In the discussion, one of the students says Poe's especially famous for his short stories, and "The Fall of the House of Usher" is certainly one of his best known, and another student says it really creates a terrifying mood and pulls the reader into the story. From this, it can be determined that it is NOT part of Poe's philosophy that short stories should always be cheerful. You should therefore click in the NO column.
